isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION AXLES WITH CONTROLLED TRACTION DIFFERENTIALS: EATON - INSTALL - DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER ASSEMBLY IN AXLE HOUSING

svcproc.title: DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER ASSEMBLY IN AXLE HOUSING

important.para: The following instructions cover single drive axles and tandem rear axles. For tandem forward axles (diff. with power divider), refer to the appropriate Eaton Axle Service Manual.
Before installing carrier assembly, inspect and thoroughly clean interior of axle housing.

note.para: Use silicone rubber gasket compound on axle housing mating surface as shown in Figure 41. Install carrier before compound sets. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for recommended gasket materials.

figure.caption: Figure 41. Use Silicone Rubber Gasket Compound on Axle Housing Mating Surface

step1.para: Install differential carrier assembly in axle housing. Install stud nuts and lockwashers, tighten to 55 to 61 ft-lbs. (74 to 82 N•m).
Install axle shafts and stud nuts. (If used, also install lockwashers and taper dowels.)

Driver-Controlled CTD: Install shift unit on carrier, engaging swivel with slot in shift fork shaft. Install mounting nuts and flat washers. Tighten nuts to 55 to 61 ft-lbs. (74 to 82 N•m). Connect air line to unit.

Seasonal CTD: Position sliding clutch in the engaged or disengaged position, then install shift fork cover retainer and secure with self-locking nuts and washers. Tighten nuts to 55 to 61 ft-lbs. (74 to 82 N•m).
Fill axle with lube to the correct level.

svcproc.para: Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

note.para:
Shift fork cover retainer can be installed in two different positions; one to keep the sliding clutch engaged and the other to keep it disengaged. In the engaged position, the shift fork cover retainer will have the adjusting screw facing the carrier, and away from the carrier in the disengaged position. Refer to ADJUSTMENTS
for adjusting procedure.
